definition: no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
to escape/to run away/to flee

sentences.english: Product such as not escape, cannot jump high walls, the legs are hot coals burns.
sentences.chinese: 品如無路可逃，無法跳下高牆，腿被炙熱的炭火燒傷。

sentences.english: By small hills, float and handsome XingShuYuan not escape, be forced to roll down the slope.
sentences.chinese: 到了小山林，帥飄和邢書媛無路可逃，被逼滾下山坡。

sentences.english: Devil, you have no way to run today.
sentences.chinese: 國賊，今日你再無路可逃。

sentences.english: Jack: What could've happened to this girl to make her feel she had no way out?
sentences.chinese: 這個女孩到底是出了什麼事，爲何會覺得無路可逃？

sentences.english: I ain't got no way to run, all those shit manke me so mad.
sentences.chinese: 我無路可逃了，所有這些破事兒都讓人憤怒。

sentences.english: We were two miles offshore. There was no way off .
sentences.chinese: 我們在離岸兩英里遠的地方，無路可逃。

sentences.english: Locked in the room, he had no way to escape.
sentences.chinese: 他被鎖在屋裏，無路可逃。

definition: to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
red in the face/extremely angry
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
long-range raid
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
sound of gong
fight to the death/desperate struggle
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
